result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J Ferkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Sexual Assault], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund.  gb/cp   ck# 15CH074732

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Keller acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 and 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes $500 fine plus costs on cts 1 & 2 each; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $400 DNA surcharge; bond applied to fine/costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Keller states that he has received an offer, has a few details to work out.  FPT continued to 8/13/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Modified bond signed.
**document not available at time of scanning 3/27/2020
*No Violent Contact w/ with C.L.F (DOB 5/5/1970); Not enter her residence.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  State reports that the victim would like bond modified to allow contact as long as deft does not enter the residence.  Court amends bond conditions to *No Violent Contact w/ with C.L.F (DOB 5/5/1970); Not enter her residence.  FPT continued to 8/4/15 at 8:45am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: **Document not available at time of scanning 3/27/2020 rmm
*No Contact w/ with C.L.F (DOB 5/5/1970) or her residence other than e-mail contact and incidental contact involving sporting events of deft's minor children.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Keller. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner.
No contact with C.L.F. (DOB 5-5-1970) or her residence other than e-mail contact and incidental contact involving sporting events of defendant's minor children

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Robert Keller. Clerk LE. KPD Officer Pep Moretti sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Keller. Probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Keller. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 6-19-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 6-26-15 @ 8:45am. Atty. Keller moves for modification of bond conditions. State does not oppose. Bond amount continued, but conditions amended to provide for no contact with C.L.F. (DOB 5-5-1970) or her residence other than e-mail contact and incidental contact involving sporting events of defendant's minor children. Amended bond signed in court.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Robert Keller. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Keller requests adjournment. Time limits waived by def. and tolled by court. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 5-1-15 @ 9:15am. Bond continued.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
